{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3424407,"name":"sam liu","username":"catrix","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/dbc845/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-09-17T07:04:20.131Z","cooked":"

In China, the frequency range 6425~7125mhz is allocated to the national 5G/6G comminucation system.

Radio frequency allocation regulations of the Peopleâ€™s Republic of China

Chinaâ€™s Radio frequency allocation revised policy and the impacts on 5G/6G, WiFi, UWB, and radar technologies (substack.com)

Does this mean that we, the Chinese teams, will not be able to use the new radio legally during driver practices?

Meles-Braverman","username":"AriMB","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/arimb/{size}/189989_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-17T09:47:25.046Z","cooked":"

I donâ€™t have any inside information about the development of the new radio. But I can say that for the previous radios the communication bands fell on a range set aside in Israel for military communication. So we used the same radios, but with slightly different firmware to use a different legal frequency. You may get something similar for China with the new radios.

I think itâ€™s much more complicated then 5ghz and Israel. Israel banned certain frequencies within the 5ghz spectrum, so it was a firmware update to not use those certain frequencies. It appears that China requires a license to use any part of the 6ghz band.

When the new radio was first announced, Iâ€™m positive I saw Kiet post about them being in the process of seeking approvals and having appropriate firmware for operating in countries with different restrictions.

I checked that, but didnâ€™t link it here.

China wasnâ€™t on that list at the time.

You should be able to use the 2.4Ghz AP â€˜practice modeâ€™ (3rd DIP switch), but will have to wait for more information from VividHosting on what theyâ€™re able to negotiate with the government on the 6GHz side.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-09-17T18:38:08.791Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":310,"readers_count":309,"score":77.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":471341,"topic_slug":"what-if-6ghz-prohibited-by-local-legistaltion","display_username":"s-neff","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28019,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/what-if-6ghz-prohibited-by-local-legistaltion/471341/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3424575,"name":"Nathan Zhou","username":"NathanZhou","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nathanzhou/{size}/225374_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-17T19:05:46.712Z","cooked":"

Generally speaking, if CMIIT (Gong Xin Bu å·¥ä¿¡éƒ¨), Chinese equivalent of FCC donâ€™t allocate 6Ghz spectrum used by wifi 6E to be used for such purpose, thereâ€™s nothing anyone could do anything about it. There is no way to get certification or operate such radio in China unless 6Ghz radio is pretty much disabled. Itâ€™s like you canâ€™t use GMRS/FRS radio from the US in Europe or Japan.

Of course from my experience with how they do radio spectrum managment in China, the enforcement about someone using such device is pretty slack. My high school (also @catrix 's school) have cellphone jammer installed and running in student residence and it never got any complant from any authority. Some people say these are so called the Grey Area.

Also remember VH-109 (and many of the wifi 6E radio) is made in China. Probably in Shenzhen , where 5516 is located as I remember a picture @kiettyyyy posted these radio being loaded a truck with Chinese license plate started with â€˜ç²¤Bâ€™, license plate of Shenzhen from another thread. I donâ€™t know how the factory is being set up but these radio should definitely be turned on and tested in factory. I donâ€™t know how that is being coordinated. Maybe they are caged in a Faraday cage.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-09-17T19:07:54.835Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":273,"readers_count":272,"score":144.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":471341,"topic_slug":"what-if-6ghz-prohibited-by-local-legistaltion","display_username":"Nathan Zhou","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/2025-first-choice/474885/126","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"2025 FIRST choice","clicks":0},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/2025-first-choice/474885/128","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"2025 FIRST choice","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66330,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FennekinðŸ¦Š is so cute!"},"post_url":"/t/what-if-6ghz-prohibited-by-local-legistaltion/471341/7","custom_user_title":"FennekinðŸ¦Š is so cute!","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":true,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3424576,"name":"Kiet Chau","username":"kiettyyyy","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kiettyyyy/{size}/194009_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-17T19:11:58.250Z","cooked":"

Correct. WiFi 6E band are allocated for 5G usage in China.

Thereâ€™s no way for us to use the current VH-109 there.

As for testing in our CM facility in China, testing is performed in an RF chamber.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-09-17T19:11:58.391Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":259,"readers_count":258,"score":91.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":471341,"topic_slug":"what-if-6ghz-prohibited-by-local-legistaltion","display_username":"Kiet Chau","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":"Vivid-Hosting","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/5/0/50d2e846f0add7aa9489092abe0f436644dde98d.png","flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":62,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":66330,"username":"NathanZhou","name":"Nathan Zhou","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nathanzhou/{size}/225374_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6398,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":"Automatically removed quote of whole previous post.","can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"CEO @ Vivid-Hosting, Mentor @ Team 1538 / The Holy Cows"},"post_url":"/t/what-if-6ghz-prohibited-by-local-legistaltion/471341/8","custom_user_title":"CEO @ Vivid-Hosting, Mentor @ Team 1538 / The Holy Cows","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3424591,"name":"Tauseef Afraz","username":"TFM110","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tfm110/{size}/197758_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-17T19:58:39.779Z","cooked":"

I did want to ask, with the radio supporting WIFI 6E, why does the radio only offer 2.4GHz 6GHz? Whereâ€™s 5GHz?

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-09-17T19:58:39.779Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":227,"readers_count":226,"score":50.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":471341,"topic_slug":"what-if-6ghz-prohibited-by-local-legistaltion","display_username":"Tauseef Afraz","primary_group_name":"Swyft-Robotics","flair_name":"FUN","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/3/5/3523e759b0af37a7757142a8b2aa79b31f1a47c4.png","flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":60,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":6398,"username":"kiettyyyy","name":"Kiet Chau","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kiettyyyy/{size}/194009_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":39084,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC5431AM | FRC5790M| FUN | SWYFT"},"post_url":"/t/what-if-6ghz-prohibited-by-local-legistaltion/471341/9","custom_user_title":"FRC5431AM | FRC5790M| FUN | SWYFT","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3424600,"name":"Kiet Chau","username":"kiettyyyy","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kiettyyyy/{size}/194009_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-17T20:18:54.785Z","cooked":"

Keep in mind, WiFi 6E is specific to expanding 802.11ax to the U-NII-6/7/8 bands.

The IPQ5018 (Apps processor) has a built in dual RFFE supporting 2.4 GHz. The QCN9024 (baseband) is our 6 GHz transceiver with four external RFFE chips and antenna elements.

In triband configurations, there are three transceivers, there just wasnâ€™t room nor budget for it (mechanical, electrical, cost, regulatory).

This is why thereâ€™s just 2.4GHz and 6GHz as we only have two radios.
